simplified: Your dreams can show you things you didn't think about before. Many people have dreams like flying or falling. These dreams are probably the same for everyone. To understand your dreams, you must think about what you do and feel every day.

Wild dogs live in Moscow. There are 35,000 wild dogs in the city. Some dogs were born in the wild. Others were pets that people threw away. Some dogs are alone. Others live with friends. Scientists studied the dogs in 2010. They found that the dogs are very good at living in the city. They know it is safer to cross the street with people. Some dogs even understand traffic lights.

Wonder is RJ Palacio's first book. She got the idea for the book one day when she saw a girl with a face that was different from others. Wonder is a very popular book in America and has won many awards. Many schools use it to talk about bullying and being different. A movie is being made and I am excited to see what RJ Palacio writes next.

Chloe has two pet rats, Zena and Roxy. They are not typical pets. People often think rats are dirty, but Chloe knows they are clean if you take care of them. She has told many people this before, but they often don't believe her. Chloe was not a fan of rats until her friend Martin showed her his rats. She saw how nice and smart they were. Martin's rats had babies last year, and Chloe decided she wanted two of them.

Cape Town is a dangerous place for baboons. Some baboons get hurt in car accidents. Others are electrocuted when they play with electric cables. Baboons are in danger. We need to help them. The city council has a team to help baboons. They chase baboons out of the city or move them to the countryside. This helps, but baboons come back because they find food easily.

I work for a big IT company. They are based in the United States, so I work from home. This is good because I don't waste time going to the office or talking to colleagues. I work on different projects. This is helpful because I can take time off when my children have school events or I need to see a doctor. The problem is that I work late into the evening. Sometimes I miss dinner to finish my work.

Graffiti was popular in the 1990s. But some artists made street art too. They wanted to talk about war, unfairness and bad treatment. Some artists made art that looked nice. In South America, artists went to poor areas and made the walls colourful.

People see many things to buy on social media, magazines and shop windows every day. They buy more clothes and shoes than ever in the UK. It is easy to buy things online without thinking. Some big brands sell cheap clothes that you can wear a few times and then throw away.

Sam looked at the car coming up to the Big House. The horses were kicking and swishing their tails because of the flies. Sam waited. Mr Carter doesn't often come out here. It's okay with Sam. The less he sees his boss, the longer he keeps his job. Mr Carter wiped his sweat. He was getting very hot in the sun. His shirt was wet and his skin was red.

Berlin city residents complain that shooting pigs is cruel. There are arguments between hunters and people who love animals. 

The city council listened to the protests. They decided to do something else. Now, they put up fences around the pigs. It is not allowed to feed them. We will see if this works.

Suzanne likes classical Greek stories. When she was a child, one of her favourite stories was Theseus and the Minotaur. 

In this story, Athens is ruled by Crete. The people of Athens are unhappy. They want to be free. Minos, the king of Crete, makes a rule. He says the Athenians must send seven boys and seven girls to Crete each year. 

The youths are sent to a big maze. A monster lives in the maze. The monster eats the youths. But one of the youths, Theseus, fights the monster and wins. 

Suzanne thinks Katniss is like Theseus. She is a strong girl who fights for what she believes.

Zoos bring people and animals together. They teach us about taking care of animals and their homes. Some zoos help animals that were hurt in circuses or abandoned pets. These animals have a safe place to live now. Zoos also study animals and how to make them healthy again.

People are now choosing not to buy things. This is called the 'buy nothing' trend. It started in Canada many years ago and then spread to the US. Many people in the US were unhappy with how much they spent on Black Friday and Cyber Monday. On one special day, people protest and cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, groups of people help each other fix and share things they already have.

Graffiti is good art or bad? It depends on what you think. In many countries, writing on buildings is not allowed. The police stop artists who do this. They have to pay money. City councils are unhappy because cleaning graffiti costs a lot of money.

What do people think of graffiti and street art? Many now think it is a good art form. 

Street art is shown in big exhibitions in Paris, London, and Los Angeles. 

An American artist named Elura Emerald had a street art show in a New York gallery in 2008. 

She said street artists should be happy because they are just expressing themselves, not hurting anyone. They should be appreciated.

Most people have four to six dreams every night after they are ten years old. They have as many as 2,000 dreams each year. By the time they are 80 years old, they might have had 140,000 dreams. 

We forget 95-99% of our dreams. This means we remember a few thousand dreams in our lifetime. It's not hard to believe that sometimes a dream is followed by a real event that is similar. This can happen if the dream is about something that happens often in our daily lives.

The Hunger Games happens in the future. North America is destroyed. The country is called Panem. It has twelve poor districts. The Capitol is in charge. The Capitol is very rich. The districts make things for the Capitol. District 12 makes coal for the country. There used to be 13 districts. One of them, District 13, rebelled against the Capitol. They were destroyed a long time ago.

Wild animals come into cities to find food. Baboons in Cape Town, South Africa, go into houses near the city to eat. They open bins and take fruit from gardens. Some baboons even go into houses and take food from the kitchen. Baboons are strong and have hurt many pet animals. This makes city people unhappy.

Many bridge accidents happen when the bridge is being built. These accidents often happen because of a mistake made by the engineers. They make a wrong calculation. The bridge falls down because of its own weight. This can be very dangerous for the workers on the bridge.

George Lucas based his story on the hero's journey. The hero starts with a normal life, but something big happens. In Star Wars, Luke lives with his aunt and uncle, fixing robots. He finds a message from Princess Leia inside a robot called R2D2. This message is the call to adventure that starts the hero's journey.

We have a plan to stop a big asteroid from hitting Earth. It's a crazy idea, but it's real. NASA suggested this plan. We call it HAMMER. 

We will use big rockets to hit the asteroid. This will try to move it away from Earth. But if the asteroid is too close, we will use the rockets to carry bombs. The bombs will blow up the asteroid.

Campbell says the hero does not want to go on an adventure at first. Then a helper comes and helps the hero decide to go.

The hero must pass some tests, fight the bad people and meet new friends. The hero gets ready for the biggest challenge.

For Luke, the helper is Obi-Wan, the friends are Han Solo, R2D2 and C3PO. The bad person is Darth Vader in a place called the Death Star.
Some people think old things are useless. But others can use them. The internet helps people give and sell old things. Now it's easy to share things with friends. This is called the sharing economy.

In the 18th and 19th centuries, people thought dreams were important. 

One idea is that our dreams tell us things about ourselves. 

Sigmund Freud said if we understand our dreams, we can understand our feelings. 

But some people think dreams are just random things in our brains when we are sleeping. 

Our brains work while we sleep and make memories. 

When we wake up, we try to understand our dreams.

I am a freelancer. I work for myself. This is good because I have control over my work and time. 

I used to work from home, but it was hard to focus. There were too many distractions: household chores, my family asking for help, and so on. 

I tried working in a café, but the Wi-Fi was not good and I drank too much coffee. 

Now I rent a desk in a shared office with other freelancers. I like going to work in the morning and working in an office.

NASA needs money to build a new telescope called NEOCam. This telescope will help find small asteroids in space. If they get the money, they can do this in ten years. After that, they will still need to figure out how to protect the Earth from big asteroids.

Influencers on social media now share 'buy nothing' ideas. They usually talk about clothes and make-up to buy. But now they say don't buy anything. Some YouTube stars tell their viewers not to buy things for a year. Two friends in Canada tried this. They worked for a year to save money. 

They started by not buying things for three months. They learned to live without new clothes, phones, and home things. Then they stopped using services. This means no haircuts, eating out, or buying petrol for their cars. They saved $55,000 in one year.

Pi thinks religion is very important. His family is Hindu, but he likes to learn about other religions. He becomes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. Pi says he is Hindu, Muslim and Christian at the same time. When his family and teachers ask him to choose one, Pi says he wants to love God.

Some people think writing your dreams down helps you have lucid dreams. Lucid dreams are dreams where you know you're dreaming and can change what happens. You can turn a bad dream into a good one or direct the story. Then, you can make your dreams instead of just thinking about them. This way, you can still have some dreams that show you what's on your mind.

People might not know they are part of the problem because they give their old clothes to charity. But charity shops can't sell all these old clothes. Fast fashion goes out of style quickly and is often not good enough to recycle. People don't want to buy old clothes. Many clothes are thrown away. Some old clothes that charity shops can't sell go to other countries, causing more problems.

Some people go on many adventures. Meagan McGrath from Canada is one of them. She climbed the highest mountains in each country, rode a bike across Canada, and ran a long race in the Sahara Desert. It was very hot there. 

Meagan went to the South Pole to ski. But on the first day, she fell into a big piece of ice. She needed help to get out. Many people would stop at that point, but Meagan kept going. She pulled a heavy sled with her tent and food for 40 days. It was very cold and snowy.

He paints rats on Paris walls. Blek le Rat is a street artist. Now, he paints to make people think.

He paints people without homes in cities. This helps people think about homelessness.
Some cities let artists paint on walls in special areas. In Taiwan, there are 'graffiti zones' where artists can paint freely. In São Paulo, the city council lets some artists paint on subway trains.

Faith47 is from Cape Town in South Africa. She paints big, colourful pictures of people and animals. She likes to explore different places. Her work is on pavements, in empty buildings and on old cars. She likes this because it will soon be gone. This is like life, it always changes.

Gabriela used to work in a place where people respect leaders. Everyone knew their job. Leaders made big decisions. Others did not often disagree.

Her Swedish team is different. They work together with their bosses to find answers and make choices.

Gabriela knew there were big differences between her and her team. So, she asked them what they thought about her being their leader. They were happy to tell her their thoughts. They said they didn't like being told what to do all the time. They wanted more freedom to make their own choices. When Gabriela told them exactly what to do, they felt she didn't trust them. They said they wanted to work together well, not just follow orders.
Os Gêmeos are twin brothers from São Paulo. They paint tags and big pictures on buildings. Their work is very big, so they need cranes to help. They painted a whole castle in Scotland in 2007.

People have painted on walls for a long time. In the past, people in Africa and Europe drew pictures of animals and people in caves. We find graffiti on old buildings in Greece, Italy, Syria and Iraq. In the town of Pompeii, archaeologists found many examples of graffiti written in Latin. These say things about love, politics and magic.

I dream of climbing big mountains. Do you? Many people want to climb Mount Everest or walk to the South Pole. They go every year. Some people use special tools like GPS and phones to help them. They are kind to nature and want to help others.

DART is a test. It will hit a small asteroid. The small asteroid is called Didymoon. It is 150 metres wide. Didymoon goes around a bigger asteroid. The bigger asteroid is 800 metres wide. The test will happen on the moon of this asteroid.

Katniss Everdeen is a sixteen year old girl. She lost her father in a mining accident. She must help her family. Katniss hunts in the woods with her friend Gale. She is very good with a bow and arrow. 

Her little sister Prim is chosen for the games. Katniss says she will go instead. The other boy from District 12 is Peeta. Katniss and Peeta are in the games together.

Writing about your dreams helps you remember more details. Think about the people and place in the dream. This can help you understand its meaning. After one week, you will have written a lot. Now, you can connect your dreams to things that happen in your life.

Wooden bridges were made a long time ago. They were easy to burn. Many old train bridges were made of wood. They were a fire risk. The trains could make sparks. These sparks could cause a fire. The fire could destroy the bridge.

Street art will be different in the future. Many young people paint in their city or neighbourhood. More street artists are now working in different countries. They use the internet to talk to each other and show their work. People in the art world think street art is a real art form. We don't know what will happen, but street art will be here.

Suzanne Collines does not like war news on TV. Her father was a pilot in the US Air Force when she was a child. He fought in Vietnam. Suzanne's mother did not want her to know about the war. But Suzanne saw the news on TV and knew her dad was there. She was very scared.

A big company called PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) did a survey. They asked people born between 1983 and 1993 and other people about their jobs. 

They asked about things like how people work together, how much money they earn, how to get better jobs, and how to have a good work-life balance. 

Another big company, Deloitte, did a different survey. They asked over 10,000 people born between 1983 and 1993 about their jobs. They wanted to know what people think about the problems and opportunities at work.

Erik Weihenmayer is a man from the United States. He is very brave and does many exciting things. He rode a bike in the desert in Morocco, kayaked in the Grand Canyon, and climbed Mount Everest. Erik is blind. He lost his sight when he was 13 years old. He wants to help people with disabilities. He takes groups of young blind people on climbing trips.

Online platforms help people make money quickly. 

For example, busy parents cannot sell old things at the market or car boot sale. 

Now, they can sell their children's old clothes and toys online. 

They can sell things like baby clothes and expensive baby equipment. 

This helps them get some money back.

Pi and Richard Parker are in a lifeboat for 227 days. They are very hungry and sick. They also have to deal with big storms and very hot sun. They survive all these problems. Pi finds comfort in his three religions, but he is often lonely and sad. He waits a long time for land. Finally, the Mexican coast is visible.

Chloe came home from school. She made a cup of coffee and went to her bedroom. She had homework, but she could do it later. She wanted to relax for a little while. The house was quiet and it was a good time to play with her pet rats.

NASA's team looked at the big rocks near Earth in 2010. They found 90% of the big rocks that are 1km wide. These rocks are like mountains and are near Earth. They are within 50 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. NASA knows about 887 of these rocks. None of them are a danger to Earth.

Auggie goes to school for the first time. He is very nervous like all children starting at a new school. But it is hard for him because of how he looks. People do not want to sit next to him. They stare at him or talk about him. 

Auggie makes friends with Jack and Summer. They are in his class and he talks to them at lunch. But it is not easy. His classmates do not want to touch him. They are afraid of getting sick. 

Auggie has a hard time at school. He has many good and bad days. Then something big happens at school camp. It changes everything for Auggie.

Two men looked to the north end of the property. It is very big. You can't see the fences from where they stand. It's not easy to run away on foot. Sam saw a big horse kicking its hooves. Can the boy ride a horse? he thought. There is a lot of trouble if you know how to ride. But there is also trouble if you don't know how to ride and want to leave your father.

Every year, many people climb Mount Everest. They are very old or very young. Some are as young as thirteen, and some are as old as eighty. Climbing high mountains is very dangerous, but the best climbers look for new challenges. 

Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner from Austria likes climbing mountains. She started climbing when she was a teenager. After school, she worked as a nurse, but she still climbed mountains.

Gerlinde climbed Everest. She wants to climb all 8,000 metre peaks now. She will climb 14 mountains in total. 

To make it harder, Gerlinde climbs without oxygen tanks. This is not safe because it's hard to breathe at high altitudes. 

Gerlinde is famous for climbing. She uses her fame to help poor children in Nepal.

We look at things we own. We notice not all things are used. 

The thick coat we thought was cool is not used because we live in a hot country. 

Our old smartphone is not used because we have a new one. 

Our car is not used often. 

We have a room in our house that is not used for guests. It is used for storing things.

Dreams are important in many cultures. People think dreams are messages from a higher power. They give us knowledge or help us understand things. 

Many people remember a dream that came true later. They dreamed about something and then it happened in real life.

We are building big bridges. They help cars, trucks and trains cross water or mountains. Bridges are very important. 

Cars, trucks and trains need bridges to go over water or mountains. If a bridge falls down, people are very worried.

Gabriela was very frustrated. She sent an email to her Swedish boss about problems with her team. 

Her boss asked her two questions. He asked if her team was still doing well. He asked what she thought would help her work better with her team.

Gabriela was not happy with her boss's answer. She felt he was not helping her.

Dogs that live in groups know humans give food to small dogs. They send small dogs to ask for food for the group. Some dogs go on the metro to move around their area. Scientists do not know how dogs know when to get off the train. Dogs may use their good sense of smell to find their way. They may also hear the names of stations on the announcements. People on the metro see dogs now and do not think it is strange.

Ed Stafford is the first person to walk the Amazon River. He started in Peru and finished in Brazil two years and four months later. He walked 6,000 kilometres. The Amazon is a dangerous place with snakes, crocodiles and jaguars. But Ed was safe. He got some mosquito and ant bites, but that's all.

In Britain, people spend £1,000 on new clothes each year. This is four per cent of their income. They spend most of this money on credit cards. 

British people owe £670 to credit card companies. This is 66 per cent of the money they spend on new clothes. 

People often buy things they don't need. They throw away 300,000 tons of clothes each year. Most of these clothes go to landfill sites.

Ed's walk was not easy. He used a radio to ask people for food and to cross their land. People came to meet him and helped him on his difficult journey. 

Ed walked and wrote about his day. He used the radio to talk to people and get help. Many people were interested in his trip. Ed used this to talk about the rainforest and raise money for good causes in Brazil and Peru.

Companies use the sharing economy to earn money. They want to use things that are not used much. A new way of doing business is popular. Companies make a website to help people find things they need. Airbnb is a company that helps people rent their rooms and houses. People can earn money by renting out their homes. Uber is another example. It helps people use their cars to make extra money when they are free.

Zoos help endangered animals. They have trouble finding mates and breeding in the wild. They are also in danger from hunters, losing their homes and other animals. 

A good zoo gives them a safe place to live and have babies. This is important because some wild animals are becoming too alike. This is a problem because it makes them weaker. Zoos help by breeding animals and releasing them back into the wild. This makes the wild animals stronger.

Bridges can fall down. This can happen for many reasons. 

Trains are fast and can break a bridge. Boats are heavy and can also break a bridge. 

We need to be careful with bridges. We must plan to avoid accidents. New ideas can help. They can find weak bridges and make work safer.

Pi is scared of the animals. He jumps into the ocean. Then he remembers there are sharks in the water. He must go back to the boat.

One by one, the animals in the boat fight and eat each other. Only Pi and a big cat are left. The cat, which Pi names Richard Parker, is feeling sick. He does not want to eat Pi right now.

When Pi is 16, a new government is elected. His parents don't like it. They are worried about the future. They decide to close the zoo and move to Canada. Some animals are sold to zoos in North America. Pi's family takes some animals with them on a ship to Canada. There is a big storm at sea. The ship sinks. Pi's family and the sailors all die in the water. But Pi is safe in a lifeboat. He is with a hyena, a zebra, an orang-utan and a big tiger.

The Hunger Games is a popular book for teenagers and young adults. Suzanne Collins wrote it. The book has been translated into many languages since 2008. Many people have bought it worldwide. It is the first book to sell one million electronic copies. The Hunger Games is also a movie. It was very successful. The movie made 152.5 million dollars in one weekend in North America.

We think about things during the day. We might use these thoughts to make our dreams. In dreams, our thoughts look like pictures or symbols. When we are awake, our brain is like a conversation. But when we sleep, the talking part of the brain gets quieter. The feeling part of the brain gets stronger.

Good relationships are very important for happiness. 

A study found that happy people have strong relationships with their friends and family. They spend time with them often. 

It's also good to have one person to talk to about your feelings. This is called 'self-disclosure'. 

You don't need many friends to do things with, but one close friend is enough. They must be someone you can talk to about your feelings. 

To have good relationships, you must learn to listen to others. This helps to make relationships stronger.

Carol Dweck is a psychologist. She talks about how our brains can change. We can learn new things and get better at them. We often praise people for being good at things naturally. For example, 'You are good at details' or 'You are good at planning'. But research shows that praising how we work – our effort, trying new things, and solving problems – helps us learn and get better.

The rover looks at the air around it many times. In 2014, it found methane. Methane is a simple gas. It doesn't last long. This means something on Mars is making methane. NASA says Mars sends methane into the air. The amount of methane goes up and down. It changes with the seasons.

Carol Dweck of Stanford University gave problems to ten-year-olds. The problems were a bit too hard. One group liked the challenge. They said they loved learning and could get better. They thought about what they could do in the future. 

But another group felt bad. They thought their brains were being judged. They said they failed. They thought their brains were not good enough. They could not imagine getting better.

Some of these children said they might cheat. Others looked for someone who was worse than them.

Horror movies often happen in empty places. These places can be old hospitals, empty houses or ghost towns. I think people like them because they are lonely and quiet. 

What was life like when people lived there? Why did they leave their homes? These are good questions. Maybe it's also scary because these places are quiet. Horror movie directors like them because it's believable that there's no phone signal.

The basement is a scary place in horror films. It's often where bad people hide or keep their tools. The basement is always dark and wet. You go down there by a small staircase. The basement is also creepy, even if there's nothing inside.

Gary Collins is a policeman. He was watching riots on TV at home. He saw some people he knew and decided to come back from his holiday to help. He watched CCTV for six months and found 190 people. He could see some of them just by looking at their eyes. His help was very important for the police. They had a lot of footage, 200,000 hours, but a computer program could only find one person.

I think it's interesting to think about how we can make our bodies better. We might be able to put a small computer in our brain. This will help us do maths better, see and hear things more clearly, and remember more. This idea will become more normal soon.

The talk was very good. The speaker said some true things. 

For example, parents use their phones while cooking dinner. Then their kids think it's okay to use phones while doing homework. 

The speaker also said people want to be in two places at once. They talk to someone in person, but then they talk to someone else online. I see this with my daughter and her friends. They meet, but then they talk to someone else on their phones.

The world is not always a violent place. Between World War II and 1990, there were 30 big wars that killed many people. Today, there are still some civil wars, but countries are generally getting along better than before. However, terrorism is a big problem now. Since World War II, many more civilians than soldiers have been killed in wars. But the good news is that violent crime is not as common as it used to be. In 2000, 8 people out of 100,000 were killed in violent crime. In 2015, this number went down to about 5.3 people.

Wasfia works for human rights. She has seen many projects in Bangladesh to help women and girls. But when these projects stop, women have nothing.

Wasfia saw that Bangladesh needs to help itself. She combined two things she loves: climbing and human rights. She wants to change people's attitudes towards women in her country.

Wasfia started climbing while working on projects in Tibet and Nepal. In Bangladesh, most people have never seen a mountain. She is doing a good job. Now, people in Bangladesh and the world are paying attention.

Most people think poor countries are in a bad situation. They have a lot of poverty, and bad leaders. But, this is not true. Something good is happening. 

Over 20 years, more than 700 million people have become richer and left poverty. Every year, 6 million fewer children die from sickness. More girls go to school and many people have clean water now.

Many managers give positive feedback first and last to be kind. But when they do this all the time, employees think the positive is just hiding the negative. This makes the positive less important. We should give positive feedback to help people do better, not just to be nice.

I am a member of a group that wants to stop machines that can kill people. Drones and robots are already killing people. They work mostly alone.

In the future, machines will decide who to kill by themselves. This is a problem because it is not fair and it's also very bad for humans. We must be careful with machines.

More people are learning English than any other language. English is spoken in many countries. But Chinese has the most native speakers. There is no clear connection between the number of native speakers and learners. However, more learners means more countries have speakers.

Your manager stops you and says she needs to talk about your project work. You worry all weekend. She says you did good work on the project. You think this might be a nice thing before she says something else. You know this is a common way to give feedback: say something nice, say what you really want to say, say something nice again.

Born in the USA is a popular rock album. It has many great songs. But the songs are also very sad. They tell stories about ordinary people who work hard but don't get rich or famous. They are angry and bitter. The song Glory Days is about people who remember when they were young and happy. Downbound Train is about a young man who loses his job and is very sad. The artist probably wrote these songs about people he knows. He is a very good singer.

Lewis wants more protected sea areas. He thinks 3% is too little. 10% is better. This will help the sea. People are hurting it. They overfish and pollute the water. Lewis has seen the damage. He swam over coral reefs that are dying. The water is too warm. Lewis saw a lot of plastic in the Red Sea. There was no life. Lewis thinks nature can heal if we don't hurt it. We must act now. If we don't take care of the sea, we will have a big problem.

Terrie Sharp is a famous writer. She has won two awards for her crime stories. She was born in a place in Glasgow where there are many crimes. She had to be careful and quiet when she was young. She learned how to open car doors with a knife, but she only used this skill to write her books. Now, she talks on TV and at writing meetings in the UK.

Things are not getting better every day. Progress is still possible. 

Steven Pinker writes a book called Enlightenment Now. He looks at the world and finds some good news. We live longer, are healthier, and are freer. We are also happier. 

But there is a problem. People do not believe in reason and science. Commentators and some leaders make people angry and scared. They say things that make people want to fight with each other. This is bad for our country and the world.

In old horror films, people in trouble couldn't call for help. Now, mobile phones make this less believable. 

To make horror films believable, there is no phone signal. 

If you are a hero in a horror film, you will not have a signal when you need it. Your phone will be dead.

In the 1950s, banana farmers in Central America had a big problem. Their best-selling banana, Gros Michel, was dying. Now, the Cavendish banana is also dying. Gros Michel was a good banana. It had thick skin and was sweet. People could easily transport it. This banana was everywhere in Central America. A big company, United Fruit, grew and sold many Gros Michel bananas. They copied shoots from plants, not from seeds. They grew the plants very close together.

Spider venom is in most spider species. It helps them catch their food, not hurt people. Only 25 spider species have venom that can hurt humans. But spider bites are not usually deadly. Most spider bites are painful, but not serious. Australia's Sydney funnel-web spider has not killed anyone since 1981. We have a medicine to stop its venom. But be careful with hairy spiders like tarantulas. They get angry when they feel scared. They throw out bad hairs to protect themselves. These hairs can hurt if they get in your eyes or skin.

Horror films from a long time ago often used this idea. 

The film starts with happy teenagers. They die one by one. Only one girl survives. 

At the beginning, the girl is weak and shy. She becomes strong and clever. 

The last girl usually lives in the end.

We want to know how we can speak many words. We need to look at our brains and how they are different from other animals. This is not just about brain size. We must know what else our brains can do and why. There are not many clues in the past. Our ancestors left us things, but these things do not tell us what they could say. 

We can see how the mouth, throat and tongue changed. About 100,000 years ago, humans could make many different sounds. Before that, scientists are not sure if early humans spoke in simple sounds.

Girls should study arts and humanities, not maths and physics. This is what society tells us. But there are no good female role models for science. We see men in cartoons and stories as scientists, inventors, and astronauts. People think scientists are not friendly and have no friends. They think scientists work alone. This is not true. The media shows these false pictures. But it makes girls not want to be scientists. If girls saw women doing science jobs, they would be more confident and like science more.

The Scallion newspaper is printed every week. It is free and goes to 10,000 students in the university buildings. Students write and make it. Many students and staff like the newspaper because it is fun, helps them learn about culture, and gives them work experience. 

Printing the newspaper costs a lot of money. Some students cannot get a copy easily because they must go to the university to get one. This is a problem. Many copies of the newspaper end up as trash on campus.

We have a problem at Girox Foods. Many employees leave each year. They leave faster than usual. The industry average is seven percent. This report will look at why employees are not happy at work. We will give advice on how to make the workplace better.

I agree with the speaker. Being connected to technology can make us feel lonely. My generation is different. We grew up without phones and computers. We know how to be alone. It's good to be alone sometimes. Young people under 20 talk a lot online, but they feel lonely. They need to learn to be alone and enjoy their own company. They talk to people through messages, not in person. This is not good for real conversations.
When you say yes and then no, people don't listen to yes. It's better to say yes and then give praise. Then people will be happy.

You might have dreams that give you clues about things you weren't aware of thinking about. Many people have similar dreams, like flying or falling, losing their teeth or being naked in public. These dreams probably mean the same thing for most people. However, to understand what they mean to you, you need to link them to what happens and how you feel in your daily life.

Wild dogs in Moscow show how animals can live in cities. There are about 35,000 wild dogs in the city. Some were born in the wild, while others were abandoned by their owners. Some dogs live alone, while others are in groups. 

These dogs can cross roads safely with people. They even understand the basics of traffic lights. Researchers studied them in 2010 and found that they have adapted well to city life.

Wonder is RJ Palacio's first novel. She explains on her website that the idea for the book came to her after seeing a girl with a facial deformity on the street one day. The book has been a bestseller in the United States and has won several awards. Many schools are using it to talk about bullying, friendship, and being different. A film version is being made, and I'm looking forward to seeing what RJ Palacio writes next.

Chloe has two pet rats called Zena and Roxy. She knows that people often think rats are not good pets, but she wants to show that they are if you take care of them properly. Chloe used to think the same, but her friend Martin changed her mind. He has pet rats and Chloe saw how friendly and clever they are. When Martin's rat had babies, Chloe decided to get two of them.

Cape Town can be a challenging place for baboons. Some have been hurt or killed in car accidents. Others have been electrocuted when they play with power cables. Baboons are in danger, and the city council wants to protect them and solve problems between humans and baboons. They have hired a team called Baboon Monitors to help.

The monitors' job is to scare baboons out of the city or catch them and release them in the countryside. This policy has worked a bit, but it's hard to keep baboons away once they think the city is a good place to find food.

I work for a big IT company that has offices all over the world. However, since their main office is in the States, I do my job from home. This means I save time and don't have to talk to colleagues about things that aren't work-related. I work on different projects, and this flexibility is great because I can easily take time off when my kids need me to go to their school events or if I need to go to the dentist. Sometimes, though, I work late into the evening and skip dinner to finish my tasks.

In the 1990s, graffiti still existed but street art became very popular worldwide. Some artists made art to talk about serious issues like war, inequality and unfair treatment. Others focused on creating nice and attractive work. In South America, many street artists worked in poor areas to add colour and beauty to dull city walls.

People are constantly shown things to buy on social media, in magazines, and in shop windows. As a result, British consumers are buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. Online shopping makes it simple for customers to buy things without much thought. Many big brands sell cheap clothes that people can use a few times and then throw away.

Sam looked up at the sun to see the dust from the car making its way up to the Big House. The horses were swishing their tails at flies, not worried about their owner's first visit in ten months. Sam waited. Mr Carter didn't usually come out here unless he had to, and that was okay with Sam. The less he saw of his boss, the longer he'd keep his job. Mr Carter wiped the sweat from the back of his neck. The sweat on his shirt was making dark patches, like shapes in a map. He was already getting a red glow from the sun. This was the kind of tan you got when you worked inside and someone else did the hard work.

Many people living in Berlin, Germany said that shooting pigs was not kind and there were strong disagreements between hunters and people who love animals. The city council listened to the complaints and decided to do something different. They put up fences to keep the pigs out and made it against the rules to give them food. We will see if this new plan works, but it might be hard to stop the pigs because winters are getting warmer and there are more of them than before.

Suzanne Collins, the author of The Hunger Games, was inspired by classical Greek mythology. One of her favourite stories as a child was about Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, the city of Athens is ruled by Crete, but the people of Athens rebel against the ruler, Minos. As a punishment, Minos makes the Athenians send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. The young people are then thrown into a maze called the labyrinth, where a monster called the Minotaur eats them. However, one of the youths, named Theseus, fights the Minotaur and kills it. Suzanne sees Katniss Everdeen as a brave and strong character, similar to Theseus.

Visiting zoos can be a great way to learn about animal conservation and understand why we need to protect wildlife and their habitats. Many zoos offer a safe haven for animals that have been mistreated in circuses or abandoned by their owners. These zoos also play a significant role in studying animal behaviour and providing care for sick animals.

A new movement is emerging against consumerism - the 'buy nothing' trend. It started in Canada in the early 1990s and then spread to the US. People in the US were unhappy with the way they spent money on Black Friday and Cyber Monday during Thanksgiving weekend. On Buy Nothing Day, people often protest and cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, groups of people who support this movement share and fix things they already own.

Is graffiti art or vandalism? It's up to you to decide. However, in many places, writing or painting on public or private property is seen as vandalism. Many street artists have been caught by the police and some have had to pay a fine. This is because city councils say it's expensive to clean graffiti off buildings, buses, and trains.

The art world's view on graffiti and street art is changing. Many people now see it as a valuable art form. In recent years, there have been big exhibitions of street art in galleries in Paris, London, and Los Angeles. In 2008, an American artist named Elura Emerald organised a street art show in a New York gallery. She believed that street artists should be respected because they are just expressing themselves and not causing any harm.

Most people have four to six dreams every night after they reach ten years old. This means they have approximately 2,000 dreams each year. By the time they are 80 years old, the average person might have had around 140,000 dreams. Even if we forget 95-99 per cent of our dreams, we still remember a few thousand across our lifetime. It's not surprising that people often notice strange coincidences, like a dream event being followed by a similar real-life event, especially if the dream is about something that happens frequently in their daily lives, which can make it seem like a coincidence is more likely to happen.

The Hunger Games happens in a future where North America has been destroyed. The country is called Panem and has 12 poor districts controlled by the rich Capitol. The Capitol has complete control over the country. Each district makes different things for the Capitol. District 12, where the story starts, provides all the coal for the country. There used to be 13 districts but one of them, District 13, rebelled against the Capitol a long time ago and was wiped out.

Wild animals occasionally wander into cities in search of food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons have started visiting residential areas near the city because they are looking for something to eat. They open rubbish bins and take fruit from gardens and orchards. Some baboons have even entered people's homes and taken food from kitchen cupboards and fridges. However, baboons can be aggressive and have injured many pet animals, so many city residents do not want them in the area.

Many accidents on bridges happen while the bridge is being built. These accidents usually happen because of a mistake made by the engineers, like a wrong calculation. The bridge collapses, and this can be very dangerous for the workers who are on it.

George Lucas was one of the first film directors to base his story on the hero's journey. Usually, the hero starts in a normal life, but something happens that makes them go on an adventure. In the beginning of Star Wars, Luke lives with his aunt and uncle, fixing robots. When he finds a message from Princess Leia inside a robot called R2D2, it's the moment that starts the hero's journey.

One way to stop a large asteroid from hitting the Earth is to destroy it with a nuclear explosion. This might sound like a plot from a science fiction film, but it's actually a real plan that NASA has considered. They call it the HAMMER plan.

To achieve this, they would send powerful rockets towards the asteroid to try and alter its path. If the asteroid is close to Earth, the rockets would carry nuclear bombs to prevent it from causing any damage.

The hero in a story often starts by saying no to a big opportunity, but then a wise person helps them and they decide to take the risk. They go into a new and exciting world where the adventure takes place. The next step is to face challenges and make difficult choices. The hero might meet new friends who help them, but they will also meet people who want to stop them. For Luke Skywalker, the wise person was Obi-Wan, his friends were Han Solo and the robots R2D2 and C3PO, and the person trying to stop him was Darth Vader inside the Death Star.

Underused items can be useless to some people, but might be useful to others. With the internet, people have found a way to make money from sharing these unwanted things. Websites and social media groups make it easy for people to buy and sell second-hand goods. This is now called the sharing economy.

In the 18th and 19th centuries, people thought that dreams were important. They believed that things we see in our dreams can tell us things we don't know about ourselves. This idea is that understanding our dreams can help us understand our feelings and problems. But another idea was that dreams are just a mix of things our brain does when we're sleeping. Our brain organises memories while we sleep, and when we wake up, we try to make sense of the images and feelings.

I work for myself as a freelancer. This is good because I have control over my work and my time. At first, I worked from home, but it was difficult to focus. There were many distractions: household chores, family members needing my attention, and other things. So, I started going to a nearby café to work. However, the Wi-Fi was not good and I drank too much coffee. I then decided to rent a desk in a shared office with five other freelancers. I liked getting dressed to go to work and being able to focus in a quiet office.

Whether NASA can find the remaining middle-sized near-Earth objects depends on getting the money to build NEOCam, a space telescope that uses infrared light to locate asteroids. If it gets the money, it could probably achieve its goal in ten years. Once they are logged, the planetary defence team would still need to figure out how to stop truly worrying asteroids – the potentially hazardous asteroids.

The 'buy nothing' trend has spread to social media influencers who normally share posts about things to buy. Some YouTubers now tell their viewers not to buy anything for a year. Two friends in Canada tried living without buying non-essential things for a year. They started by giving up buying electrical goods, clothes, and home items for three months. Next, they stopped using services like haircuts, eating out, and filling up their car with petrol. After a year, they had saved $55,000.

Pi believes that religion is very important. However, his family follows Hinduism, and he has friendships with people from other faiths, including a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. This might seem unusual, but Pi thinks it's possible to believe in multiple religions at the same time. When his family and teachers ask him to choose just one, he says that he simply wants to love God. As a result, they agree to let him decide what he believes about religion for himself.

Some people think writing down their dreams can help them control them better. When you have a lucid dream, you know you're dreaming and can choose what happens. This lets you change a bad dream into a good one or take control of the story. However, you might also want some dreams where your mind can freely express your thoughts and feelings.

People might not know they're contributing to the problem of disposable clothing because they donate their old clothes to charity. However, charities can't sell all the clothes they receive. Fast fashion is trendy for a short time, but it's often low quality and can't be recycled. As a result, many of these clothes are thrown away, and some are sent to other countries, causing more economic and environmental issues.

Some adventurers are not content with just one thrilling experience. They continually seek out new challenges. Meagan McGrath from Canada is a good example. She has climbed the highest mountain on each continent, cycled across Canada, and completed a long-distance race in extremely hot conditions in the Sahara Desert. However, her most impressive journey was a skiing trip to the South Pole. On the first day, she had a serious accident while skiing into a glacier and had to be rescued. Many people would have given up at that point, but Meagan decided to continue. She eventually reached the South Pole after forty days, pulling a sledge with a tent and food through harsh weather and ice storms.

Blek le Rat started painting rats on Paris city walls when he was young. Now, he wants people to think about important social issues. He paints pictures of homeless people in cities to make people consider the problem of homelessness.

In some areas, councils have tried to stop artists from painting graffiti on walls randomly by letting them work in special areas. For example, Taiwan has 'graffiti zones' where artists can paint and write freely. In São Paulo, Brazil, the city council has allowed some artists to paint on the city's subway trains.

Faith47 is a South African artist from Cape Town. She creates large, vibrant paintings of people and animals. Her work often appears in unusual locations, such as city streets, abandoned factories, and old cars. Faith47 believes that the temporary nature of street art, which is often removed by the weather or city cleaners, is a reflection of life's constant change.

In her old job, Gabriela was used to a place where people respected those in charge. Everyone knew their role and followed the rules. Leaders made the important decisions and were not often questioned. However, her Swedish team worked differently. They were used to a team-based approach where everyone worked together to find solutions and make decisions. Their leaders were more like coaches who encouraged people to think for themselves and expected to be challenged.

Gabriela noticed the cultural differences between her and her team. She decided to talk to them about how they felt about her leading the team. They were happy to share their thoughts. Gabriela's team said they were used to doing things their own way. They liked having more freedom to make decisions and be creative. When Gabriela told them exactly what to do, they felt she didn't trust them. They explained that they were trying to do their job well, but Gabriela thought they were trying to challenge her decisions. They told her that was just how they worked.

Os Gêmeos are twin brothers from São Paulo who are well-known for their street art. They create a wide range of artworks, from small graffiti tags to large-scale murals on building walls. Their murals are often enormous, which is why they sometimes need to use cranes to put them up. One notable example is the time they painted an entire castle in Scotland back in 2007.

People have been painting and writing on walls for a long time. In the past, people in Africa and Europe used to paint pictures of animals and people in caves. You can still see ancient graffiti on buildings at sites in Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq. Archaeologists have found many examples of graffiti in the Roman town of Pompeii, written in Latin. These include messages about love, politics, and even magic.

Do you ever imagine climbing Mount Everest or walking to the South Pole? Many people attempt to climb the world's highest mountains or walk across continents each year. However, unlike the explorers of the past, today's adventurers use modern tools such as GPS and satellite phones to make their journeys safer and more efficient. Some people travel to help protect the environment, while others aim to assist those in need and raise money for charitable causes.

The first test is called DART, which stands for Double Asteroid Redirection Test. It's planned to take place on the moon of an asteroid called Didymos. Didymos has a small moon called 'Didymoon', which is 150 metres wide and orbits the larger 800-metre asteroid. The goal is to knock Didymoon out of its orbit with the impact of DART, so that Earth-based telescopes can see it.

Katniss Everdeen, a 16-year-old girl, lost her father in a mining accident. She now has to work hard to feed her family. Katniss hunts in the woods near District 12 with her friend Gale and becomes very good at using a bow and arrow. When her little sister, Prim, is chosen to participate in the Games, Katniss decides to take her place. The other participant from District 12 is a boy named Peeta, and Katniss soon finds herself in a complicated situation with him.

Writing about your dreams will help you remember more details. Think about the people and places in your dream, as they might be important too. After a week, you'll be surprised at how much you've written down. Then, you can start linking your dreams to what happens in your daily life and how you feel.

In the past, many bridges were made of wood and were more likely to catch fire. This was especially true for old train bridges, where sparks from the steel wheels and tracks could sometimes start a fire and destroy the bridge.

Street art is changing and we can notice some new trends appearing. Many young people are making street art in their own city or neighbourhood. Some artists, however, are now moving abroad to work in different countries. The internet has helped artists to communicate with each other and show their work. Because of this, street art is getting more recognition as a serious art form. It's hard to say what will happen in the future, but it's clear that street art is here to stay.

Suzanne Collins doesn't enjoy watching news about wars because it disturbs her. This is due to a personal experience. Her father was a pilot in the US Air Force when she was a child. He served in Vietnam, which had a significant impact on her life. Although her mother tried to shield her from the details, she still saw the news about the war on television. This made her concerned about her father's safety, which was a worrying time for her. Even now, it still affects her.

A global survey by PricewaterhouseCoopers asked over 40,000 people about their workplace. They looked at things like how people work together, communication, and what they earn. The survey also asked about career growth, balancing work and life, and other topics. 

Another survey by Deloitte asked over 10,000 millennials about their views on the challenges and opportunities in the modern workplace.

Erik Weihenmayer is an American who enjoys adventure activities. He has cycled across the deserts of Morocco, kayaked through the Grand Canyon, and climbed Mount Everest. It's remarkable that Erik has been blind since he was 13 years old. Despite his disability, Erik wants to show others with disabilities that they can live active lives. He leads groups of young blind people on climbing trips to inspire them and prove that anything is possible.

People can now make some extra money using online platforms. For instance, busy parents wouldn't normally sell their children's old things at the local market, but now they can use online marketplaces to sell their nearly new baby clothes and expensive baby equipment that their children have grown out of. This helps them get some money back.

Pi and Richard Parker stay in the lifeboat for 227 days. They face many challenges like hunger, illness, and extreme tiredness. They also experience violent storms and the hot Pacific sun, but they manage to stay alive. Pi finds comfort in his three religions sometimes, but he feels lonely and hopeless at other times. When the Mexican coast appears on the horizon, everything changes.

Chloe came home from school, made a cup of coffee, and took it to her bedroom. She had homework, but she could do it later. She wanted to relax for a bit before her parents came home and the house got noisy with people talking, the TV on, or her dad listening to music while he cooked dinner. She liked this quiet time because she could play with her pet rats.

NASA's planetary defence team identified and logged most of the big asteroids near Earth in 2010. They found about 90 per cent of the asteroids that are at least 1 kilometre wide. These asteroids are called 'near-Earth objects' or NEOs. They are as big as mountains and are within 50 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. There are about 50 more that need to be logged. NASA knows about 887 asteroids, but none of them are a threat to the planet.

Having decided to go to school, Auggie faces his first day. He's very anxious, like most kids starting at a new school. However, it's even harder for him because of the way he looks. Nobody wants to sit next to him and he notices kids staring at him or talking about him behind their hands. Fortunately, he makes friends with Jack, a boy in his class, and Summer, a girl he chats with at lunch. But things don't get easier. Auggie's classmates are afraid to touch him because they think he might catch something. Throughout the school year, Auggie goes through many difficult times. Then, a traumatic event happens at a school camp that changes everything.

The two men looked towards the north end of the property. It went on and on as far as they could see. The fences were barely visible from where they stood. However, no matter how bored or rebellious a teenage boy might be, it was impossible to escape on foot. Sam looked at the biggest horse, which was kicking its legs with its heavy hooves. Could the boy ride? he thought. There was a lot of trouble a good rider could get into out here, far from anyone. But there might also be trouble for someone who didn't know how to ride and wanted to get away from his father.

Over 4,000 people have successfully climbed Mount Everest, with ages varying from 13 to 80. While climbing high mountains in harsh weather conditions is still extremely hazardous, many experienced climbers now seek new and exciting challenges. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner, an Austrian climber, began her mountaineering career as a teenager. After completing her education, she worked as a nurse, but she continued to climb mountains in her free time because she enjoys it.

Gerlinde climbed Mount Everest and then decided to tackle all 14 mountains over 8,000 metres high. She makes it even more challenging by climbing without oxygen tanks, which is a big risk because high mountains can cause problems with your brain and body. In fact, she uses her climbing fame to help a charity that supports poor children and orphans in Nepal.

If we think about the things we've bought, we'll probably notice that not everything is useful. We might have a thick coat that looks nice but is useless here, a phone that we replaced with a newer one, a car that only gets used on weekends, or a spare room that's now a storage space.

Throughout history and across cultures, people have thought that dreams are connected to the future. They believed that dreams are messages from a higher power, sent to help us understand or learn something new. Many people can remember a time when they dreamed about something and then it actually happened in real life.

Some of the biggest and most expensive transportation projects involve building bridges. Bridges are important connections that help cars, trucks, and trains cross rivers, mountains, or other roads. When bridges collapse, they receive a lot of attention, which is why they are closely examined.

Gabriela emailed her Swedish manager after weeks of problems with her team. He asked if she thought her team was still working well and what would help her work better with them. Gabriela thought her manager was being unclear and didn't think he was handling the situation properly.

Dogs that live in groups have learned that people are more likely to give food to smaller, cuter dogs. So, these dogs are sent to beg for food for the whole group. Some dogs have even learned to use the city's metro to travel from one part of their territory to another. Scientists are not sure how the dogs know when to get off the train. One idea is that they use their sense of smell to find their favourite places. Another possibility is that they have learned to recognize the names of stations they hear in announcements. This way, they can get to where they want to go. Now, metro passengers are used to seeing dogs on the trains, so they don't usually notice them.

Ed Stafford, a British explorer, made history by becoming the first person to walk along the entire length of the Amazon River. He started his incredible journey at a tiny stream in the Andes mountains of Peru and successfully completed it two years and four months later, after covering an impressive 6,000 kilometres. The Amazon rainforest is known for being a hazardous environment, home to deadly creatures such as poisonous snakes, crocodiles, and jaguars. Fortunately, Ed managed to avoid any serious harm and only suffered a few thousand mosquito and ant bites during his adventure.

In the UK, people spend over £1,000 on new clothes each year. This is about four per cent of their income. While it doesn't seem like a lot, this figure hides two big problems. First, many people use credit cards to buy clothes. On average, each adult in the UK owes £670 to credit card companies. This is more than half of the money people spend on new clothes. Additionally, people are buying things they don't need and can't afford. As a result, the UK throws away 300,000 tons of clothing every year, most of which ends up in landfill sites.

Ed's walk would have been very hard without technology. He used a radio to ask the people of the rainforest for food and permission to cross their land. They came to meet him and helped him through the toughest parts. Ed also kept a blog, writing about his daily adventures. He used the attention from the media to speak out against the destruction of the rainforest and to collect money for charities that help the environment and children in Brazil and Peru.

Companies are now using the sharing economy because it can be profitable. They want to use things that are not being used. One idea is to create a website that connects people who need something with people who can offer it. For example, Airbnb helps people earn money by renting out their empty rooms and houses. Uber is another example - it lets people use their own cars to give passengers a lift and earn some extra money.

Zoos play a vital role in helping endangered species. In the wild, some of these species have trouble finding partners and reproducing because they are hunted, lose their homes, and have many predators. A good zoo gives these animals a safe place to live and have babies. 

This is especially important when some wild animal populations are getting smaller. If they become too similar, it can be bad for them. Zoos help by breeding animals in a safe environment. Then, some of these animals can be released back into the wild to make the populations more diverse.

Both types of accidents are very rare, but they happen for different reasons. Boats can cause a bridge to collapse because of their big size, even if they're moving slowly. Trains can cause a bridge to fall down because of their speed. We need to be prepared for these accidents. Using modern technology to find weak points, creating safer workplaces and designing bridges better can all help to prevent these terrible accidents.

When Pi first encounters the animals, he's extremely frightened and dives into the ocean. However, he soon remembers that there are sharks in the water, which makes him decide it's safer to return to the lifeboat. Unfortunately, the animals in the lifeboat start to fight each other, and one by one, they get killed. Eventually, only Pi and the tiger are left. It's fortunate for Pi that the tiger, which he later names Richard Parker, is unwell and not hungry at that moment.

When Pi is 16, his parents disagree with the new government and are concerned about the future. They decide to leave the country and move to Canada, but things don't go as planned. They sell some animals to zoos in North America and take the rest with them on a ship. Unfortunately, the ship hits a storm and sinks, resulting in the death of Pi's family and the sailors on board. However, Pi manages to survive in a lifeboat with a hyena, a zebra, an orang-utan, and a big tiger.

The Hunger Games is a well-known novel written by American author Suzanne Collins, primarily aimed at teenagers and young adults. Since its release in 2008, it has been translated into 26 languages and has sold millions of copies globally. This is remarkable, especially considering it was the first young adult book to sell over a million e-books. The novel was also adapted into a successful film, which performed similarly to the book. In its opening weekend in North America, the film earned a significant 152.5 million dollars.

Maybe our dreams are a result of our brain sorting out things we think about during the day. However, in dreams, these thoughts appear with special meanings. When we're awake, our thoughts are like conversations in our minds. But when we sleep, the part of our brain that handles language gets quieter, while the part that deals with emotions gets stronger.

Building strong relationships is crucial for our overall happiness. People who feel content often make time for their friends and family, which helps them feel more connected. Having someone to talk to is beneficial, whether it's one close friend or a group of people. It's not just about sharing activities or discussing hobbies; we also need to feel a sense of closeness and understanding with each other. Some individuals need to work on improving their listening skills to build stronger and more meaningful relationships.

Carol Dweck, a psychologist who supports the 'growth mindset', says our brains can change and we can learn new skills, even if we weren't good at them at first. We often praise people for their natural talents, like being good at details or organisation. But research shows that if we praise how they work, like their effort and problem-solving skills, we can help them learn new things and improve their talents.

The Mars rover checks the Martian atmosphere often. In 2014, it found something interesting - methane was present. Methane is also found in natural gas on Earth. However, methane in the air doesn't last long. It disappears in a few hundred years. This means there must be a source of methane on Mars. Scientists think Mars releases methane sometimes, and the amount of methane in the air changes throughout the year. This is similar to how the Earth's atmosphere changes with the seasons.

Carol Dweck, a psychologist from Stanford University, gave a group of ten-year-olds some difficult problems to solve. She wanted to see how they would react. One group enjoyed the challenge and thought that they could get better at solving problems. They believed in a 'growth mindset', which means they focus on what they can achieve in the future. 

However, another group felt stressed and thought that their intelligence was being tested. They had a 'fixed mindset' and thought that they couldn't improve. Some of these children even thought about cheating in the future. Others looked for someone who did worse than them to make themselves feel better.

Horror movies often take place in empty buildings. This could be an old hospital, a deserted house, or a town with no people. There's something about quiet, empty spaces. What was it like when people lived there? Why did they move away? Maybe it's also because these places are so quiet, which can be very frightening too. Abandoned places are also useful for film directors, as it's believable that there will be no phone signal there.

People find basements frightening in horror movies. This is often because something is hidden there or because the villain has left their tools. Basements are usually dark and damp. You have to go down a narrow staircase to get to them. Even when there's nothing down there, basements still feel creepy.

Gary Collins, a policeman not working, saw the London riots on TV. He knew some people and decided to cut his holiday short to help identify them. He spent six months looking at CCTV footage and was able to identify 190 people, often just from their eyes. His help was very important for the investigation. Even with 200,000 hours of footage, computers were only able to identify one person.

I think it's really interesting to think about how we'll improve ourselves as humans by adding technology to our bodies. Just imagine if we could put a computer inside our brain! In the future, we'll be able to do this and it will make us better at maths, help us see and hear things more clearly, and remember things more easily. This idea will become more normal over time.

It was a great talk and the speaker made some good points. For example, how can we expect teenagers not to text while doing their homework when they see their parents using their phones all the time? They might see their parents checking their phones while cooking dinner or waiting at a traffic light. The speaker also said that people often want to be in two places at once. So, they switch between their real-life conversations and their online ones. I've seen this with my daughter and her friends. They plan to meet, but then they all sit together and chat online while each one talks to someone else.

There's a mix of good and bad news when it comes to violence in the world. Between World War II and 1990, there were 30 big wars that killed over 100,000 people. However, things have improved since then. Most countries are now getting along better than they used to. But terrorism has become a big problem in recent years. Since World War II, many more civilians have died in wars than soldiers. On the other hand, the number of people killed in violent crime is still a major issue. Although it's nine times more likely to die in a violent crime than in a war, the murder rate has actually decreased slightly. It went from 8 deaths per 100,000 people in 2000 to around 5.3 in 2015.

Wasfia has spent her whole life helping people's rights. She has seen many international projects in her country that teach and train women and girls, but often these projects stop and leave them with nothing. Wasfia thought that Bangladesh needed to stand up for itself, so she combined her two interests, mountaineering and helping people's rights, to try and change how people think about women in her country. She started climbing while working on humanitarian projects in Tibet and Nepal because in Bangladesh, most people don't see mountains as they live in a flat country near the sea. Her campaign seems to be working as more and more people in Bangladesh and around the world are taking notice.

Most people think that countries with limited financial resources are struggling. They assume these countries are poor, often controlled by strict leaders, and have little chance of getting better. But this isn't entirely true. Something good is happening. Over the past 20 years, over 700 million people have seen their income rise and moved out of poverty. As a result, six million fewer children die each year because of illness. Many more girls are getting an education now, and millions of people have access to clean water.

Many managers try to make their feedback more positive by giving two nice comments and one not-so-nice comment. But when feedback is always the same, employees start to think that the nice comments are just a way to hide the bad ones. This makes the nice comments less useful. We should give positive feedback to help and encourage people to do their jobs well, not just to make the bad news easier to hear.

I'm a member of the Campaign to Stop Killer Robots. While some people think of robots like the Terminator, the reality is that military machines like drones and sentry robots are already being used to kill with very little human control. If we allow machines to decide who to kill on their own, it would be completely wrong and a danger to humanity. We need to be careful about what we ask machines to do.

"English is becoming the most popular language to learn worldwide. It's widely spoken in many countries, but Chinese still has the largest number of native speakers. It's not obvious whether the number of native speakers influences how many people choose to learn a language. Nevertheless, there is a relationship between the number of learners and the countries where the language is spoken."

Your manager stops you and says she wants to talk about your work on the project. You start to worry all weekend, thinking about what you might have done wrong. On Monday morning, you go to her office and she begins by saying you did a good job on the project. You wonder if this is just a way to start the conversation. You know this is a common way to give feedback: say something positive, then say what you really want to say, and finish with something positive again.

Born in the USA is a popular rock album with powerful songs that also have a lot of feeling. Behind the catchy music are stories about the problems of ordinary people who work hard but don't get rich or famous. Many songs talk about how people feel angry and disappointed when their lives don't go as they hoped. The song Glory Days is about people looking back at their younger days when they thought they had everything, while Downbound Train tells the story of a young man who loses his job and his life falls apart. You can imagine that the singer is writing about real people he knows and the life he might have had if he hadn't become famous. This album shows how talented the singer is.

Lewis thinks we should have more protected areas in the ocean. He wants to see this number go up from 3% to 10%. This is because people's actions, like overfishing and pollution, are hurting the environment. Lewis has seen the damage himself during his expeditions. He's seen coral reefs dying because of warmer water and underwater areas with no life and a lot of plastic in the Red Sea. Pugh thinks nature can recover if we give it a chance. However, time is running out. If we don't take care of our seas, we might have a big problem that's hard to solve.

Terrie Sharp is a well-known author who writes exciting stories. She won the Olive Crime Writer Award twice. Terrie grew up in a part of Glasgow where there was a lot of crime. She learned to be careful and not get involved in trouble. She even knew how to open car doors with a knife, but she only used this skill to write her books. Now, she talks openly on TV shows like Police Today and at writing events across the UK.

"It doesn't seem like things are getting better every day, does it? Many people think progress is becoming a thing of the past. Steven Pinker's book gives us a better understanding of human progress and has some positive news. People are living longer and healthier lives, and they're freer and happier. However, Pinker believes the main issue is that people are not using reason and science as much as they should be. When some people try to make us think in groups and doubt the future, we risk losing important things like democracy and working together as a world."

In old horror movies, it was hard for characters to get help when they needed it. They couldn't easily call the police because they didn't have phones. Mobile phones have made this situation less believable now. What's the solution to keep the suspense? No phone signal! If you're in trouble in a horror film, it's likely that you won't have a signal when you need to call for help.

In recent years, banana growers in Central America have been facing problems. Their main export, the Gros Michel banana, is becoming less popular. This is happening to the Cavendish banana, which was supposed to replace the Gros Michel. The Gros Michel banana plant was successful because its fruit was easy to transport, had a thick skin, and tasted sweet. Many plantations in Central America grew this type of banana. A big company called United Fruit found a way to grow them quickly. They copied the banana plants instead of growing them from seeds, which helped them produce a lot of bananas in a small area.

Most spiders have venom to catch their prey, not to hurt people. However, only a few species, about 25, can be dangerous to humans. You should be careful because spider bites can still be very painful. For example, the Sydney funnel-web spider hasn't killed anyone in Australia since a medicine was found to stop its venom in 1981. Some spiders, like tarantulas, can release tiny hairs when they feel scared. These hairs can be very annoying and get stuck in your skin or eyes.

This horror movie theme was very popular in the late 20th century. It typically begins with friends enjoying themselves, but ends with only one girl remaining alive. Initially, the girl is usually shy and not very strong, however, by the end, she has become very brave and resourceful. This is often the case, and the last girl usually manages to survive.

To understand where our ability for complex language came from, we need to look at how our brains are different from other animals. This isn't just about brain size; it's also about what else our brains can do and when they developed those skills. Unfortunately, there aren't many physical clues to help us understand this. We can't learn much from the things our ancestors left behind, like tools or houses, because these don't tell us how they spoke. However, we can see that early humans developed their mouths, throats, and tongues over time. By about 100,000 years ago, humans had the ability to make complex sounds. Before that, scientists can only make educated guesses about how early humans communicated.

It's our society, not nature, that tells us girls should be good at arts and humanities, and that boys are better at maths and physics. This is also because we don't often see positive female role models doing science-related jobs. Cartoons and stories often show men as crazy scientists, genius inventors, or adventurous astronauts. People also think that scientists are not very social, or that their work is lonely. These ideas are not true, but they can make girls think that science is not a good career choice for them. If we saw more women doing science, it would make girls feel more confident and like they belong in those subjects.

The Scallion is a weekly newspaper that is distributed for free in university buildings. Approximately 10,000 students read it. The paper is created and written by students themselves, which is a unique feature. People enjoy it because it's entertaining, it helps them learn about different cultures, and it provides them with work experience. Nevertheless, printing the newspaper is a costly process. Some students also find it inconvenient to obtain a copy because they need to go to the university to pick one up. As a result, many copies end up as litter on campus.

We have a problem at Girox Foods. Many staff members leave their jobs each year. In fact, about 12 per cent of our staff leave every year. This is more than usual for our industry, where only 7 per cent of staff leave each year. This report will look at why staff are unhappy and suggest ways to make the workplace better.

A lot of what the speaker said makes sense. I think it's true that being more connected can make us feel more alone. I don't see this as a big problem for my age group because we didn't grow up with technology. We know how to be by ourselves and it's okay to be alone. However, younger people are different. They're always communicating and don't get the chance to be alone, which is necessary to learn how to enjoy their own company. Also, they learn how to talk through messages that can be changed, rather than having real conversations with people in front of them.

Don't always give negative feedback after positive feedback. When we always give both together, the positive comments can become less important and ignored. It's a good idea to give positive feedback sometimes just because it's deserved, and not feel the need to add criticism every time.
